intro: Triplophyllum attenuatum, commonly known as the slenderleaf spurge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small, greenish flowers that are clustered in umbels. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in open woodlands. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
